body_html:
#8354 (which will be updated shortly) adds CUDAEvent to ATen. @goldsborough is adding a relevant CUDAGuard now, too. It is straightforward to convert the c10d stream and event wrappers to use them (I'll make sure we do that as a follow-up) we can also use them to extend the stream API to support additional synchronization behavior.

Note that c10d wraps a THCStream* which is a CUDAStreamInternal* (I added a typedef for it when porting streams to ATen). We should probably just make c10d::CUDAStream be an at::CUDAStream instead of defining another wrapper.
